job_title: Engineer Modeling & Validation of Wind Turbine Simulation Models
company_name: Fraunhofer Institute for Wind Energy Systems (IWES)
job_responsibilities: Develop validation methods for offshore wind turbines, researching suitable methods.
Evaluate added value and usability of methods on test benches.
Model and simulate offshore wind turbines.
Further development of existing MoWiT models.
Responsible for setup (incl. design basis and design load cases) and evaluation of MoWiT simulations.
Independently generate synthetic simulation data and compare with measurement data.
Document findings and results in academic publications.
Present results at conferences and specialist trade fairs.
Assist in project acquisitions by doing research.
job_requirements: Completed diploma or master’s degree with a focus on wind energy.
Experience in wind turbine simulation, modeling, and programming (in Modelica, Python, or C).
Knowledge of offshore wind turbines (especially in hydrodynamics and wave theories) is a plus.
Knowledge of verification and validation methods, ideally in offshore wind energy, is advantageous but not required.
Good command of German and English.
skills_required: Wind turbine simulation, Modeling, Programming (Modelica, Python, C), German, English, Validation methods
salary_info: Appointment, remuneration and social security benefits based on the public-sector collective wage agreement (TVöD). Performance-based variable remuneration components.
